intro: Faxonanthus, commonly known as the white sand tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly in countries like Mexico and Central America. The plants are characterized by their small, white or pale flowers that bloom in clusters. They typically grow as shrubs or small trees, often found in dry, sandy soils. Faxonanthus species are valued for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in arid environments.
